item.description: www.musicaloccupation.com - http://twitter.com/Ska_Tpodcast mad bombers society - theme from sonny & sis (butchers) king django - avenue a (brooklyn hangover) Jimmy Cliff - guns of brixton (rebirth) walkin proud - walkin pruod (walkin proud) fundamentals - gone (get alright) hellbound hepcats - play with fire (no 2) madness - my girl 2 (Oui Oui Si Si Ja Ja Da Da) chris murray & bc combo - michael & anne (cbc session) wilko - omsong (youtube) the Malchiks - jerry (skavant garde) the Malchiks - dr skank n stein (skavant garde) los furios - ska in mexico (never look back EP) danny rebel & the KGB - fire (blastoff) the swing easy orchestra - this charming man

the skints, s/t, n55, subcity dwellers, , after my heart, kinky coo coos, montjuic boneyard, montjuic boneyard, kinky coo coos, montjuic boneyard, better, baba brooks, , duck soup, easy big fella, , found love, the One night band, Hit n run, sammy, desorden publico, , hipnosis, O'luge & Citizen Cope, movements, coming back, dubblestandart, , 10 tons of dope, the Lions , , cumbia del leon the orobians, , this is the day the orobians, , the Godfather, rude city riot, , don't go away, hot knives, , in my dreams, hotknives, , dave and mary, the Slackers, self medication, happy song, chris murray, cbc session, ska music, Tim Armstrong & the Aggrolites, , oh no, Satori, , celebration, menahan street band, , montego sunset, Dubmatix, Renegade Rocker, Happy dub, bob marley & wailers, , one love lord tanamo, , taller than you are, judge dread & dr ring ding, , big 5, cartoon violence, whatever happened to the likely lad, attic, georgetown orbits, , shoe suede blues, the oldians, midnight moods

item.title: Broadcast on 25-Jul-2008
item.description:
THE CiTR SHOW SWAP The CiTR Show Swap is now in full effect. The CiTR Show Swap is when programmers are given the opportunity to see how the other half lives and host their shows for a week!
Between July 21st and July 27th, CiTR's programming schedule will turn upsidedown, so be sure to tune in for an interesting radio experience.
With host Anita Bee
item.itunes:subtitle: Show Swap 2008

item.title: Broadcast on 19-Jan-2007
item.description:
http://www.myspace.com/ska_t_scene_ik_drive
Maytals, , war no more, bob marley & wailers, , do you feel the same way too?, skatalites, , magic star,

item.title: Broadcast on 10-Nov-2006
item.description:
10  24 November 2006
9 November 2006 -Have you ever wanted to thank your favorite show host for years of commercial free alternative radio? Now you can! For the first time in its history, CiTR Radio will be hosting an on-air Funding Drive from10th to 24th November.
For almost 25 years, CiTR has been providing a much-needed alternative to mainstream media free of charge to our devoted listeners. Where else can you hear shows by noted programmers such as Nardwuar, Steve Edge, Chrisarific, Heather Kitching, DJ Ebony, Hans Kloss and the best varsity sports coverage in campus radio?
Until recently CiTR has relied on the support of UBC students for the majority of its operating costs. It has become abundantly clear that due to the high cost of operating a Campus/Community station combined with a push to modernize our station and meet the demands of digital technology, alternative forms of revenue are needed to achieve our goals.
By making a donation to CiTR Radio, listeners will be investing in the future of campus/community radio - a future in which alternative and diversified programming continues to thrive. A better outfitted station makes better radio for listeners.
We have some great incentives for those who make a donation to CiTR!
* Friends of CiTR cards (includes discounts at a number of fantastic Vancouver businesses  check www.citr.ca/friends.php for more info) * CiTR T-Shirts in various colours and sizes * Limited. Addition T-Shirts designed by local designers Dani Vachon and Andy Dixon * CiTR tote-bags * CDs in various genres * Gift certificates to local businesses * Tickets to hot shows around town
*** The more you give the more you get! Individual donations start at only $ 25! Business donations start at only $ 100!
How to donate:
Phone: call 604.822.8648 or 604.822.1242 between 10 AM and 8 PM November 10th  24th we accept Visa, MasterCard, Personal Check, Money Order, Cash or online via a secure site (Donations can be made in-person between 10 AM and 8 PM at CiTR Radio #233-6138 SUB Blvd. Vancouver, BC V6T 1Z1
Online Donations: Log onto our secure site at www.citr.ca/donate.php
For more information please check www.citr.ca or call us at 604 822 1242.
As we are nearing our 25th year anniversary and 70 years of UBC Radio, CiTR 101.9 FM would like to thank our listeners for decades of support. Through your support we look forward to another 25 years as your favorite campus/community radio station
